questions.question: What does fund operations software handle?

options.text: The financial and administrative side: capital calls, distributions, LP reporting, portfolio valuations, compliance, and fund performance tracking

questions.explanation: Fund operations software handles the financial and administrative side of running a venture fund. Capital calls, distributions, LP reporting, portfolio valuations, compliance, and fund performance tracking. This is the infrastructure that keeps your fund running legally and financially.

questions.question: When is the right time to implement proper fund operations software?

options.text: Before you raise your second fund - migrating one fund's historical data is manageable
Only if you have more than 50 LPs

questions.explanation: The right time to implement proper fund operations software is before you raise your second fund. Migrating one fund's historical data is manageable. Migrating two or three funds with years of capital calls, distributions, and portfolio changes is much harder.

questions.question: What is the recommendation regarding building fund operations software?

options.text: Always build custom fund operations software
Buy fund operations software - this is financial infrastructure, don't build it yourself
Only build if you're a small fund

questions.explanation: Unlike research platforms (which some funds might build) or sourcing tools (which some funds don't need), fund operations software is something every fund needs and should buy off the shelf. This is financial infrastructure. Don't build it yourself.

questions.question: What are the core functions of fund operations software? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Capital management - tracking commitments and calculating capital calls
Distributions - calculating waterfall and carried interest
Portfolio tracking - tracking investments and valuations

questions.explanation: Fund operations software handles: (1) Capital management - tracking commitments, calculating capital calls. (2) Distributions - calculating waterfall, carried interest, management fees. (3) Portfolio tracking - tracking investments, ownership, valuations. (4) LP reporting - generating quarterly reports with fund performance and portfolio updates.

questions.question: Which platform is good if you're already in the Carta ecosystem?
questions.explanation: Carta Fund Forecasting (formerly Tactyc) is good if you're already in the Carta ecosystem. The advantage is tight integration if you already use Carta for fund administration or if your portfolio companies use Carta for their cap tables. Strong fund forecasting and modeling capabilities.

questions.question: What is 'ecosystem lock-in' and why does it matter?

options.text: Some platforms want you in their full ecosystem (fund administration, cap tables) which can be convenient but makes switching costs high

questions.explanation: Ecosystem lock-in: Some platforms, particularly Carta, want you in their full ecosystem: fund administration, cap table management, portfolio company equity. This can be convenient if you're already committed, but makes switching costs high. If you use a different fund administrator or want flexibility, make sure the platform works well standalone.

questions.question: Why should you be realistic about fund forecasting tools?

options.text: Because VC returns are driven by outliers, not averages - models built on 'average conversion rates' may feel rigorous but miss how the industry actually works

questions.explanation: Be realistic about fund forecasting tools. Fund forecasting tools let you model scenarios, but VC returns are driven by outliers, not averages. A model built on 'average conversion rates' may feel rigorous but miss how the industry actually works. Use forecasting for communication and planning, not as a source of truth about future performance.

questions.question: Who should you onboard first when implementing fund operations software?

options.text: Your fund ops team first - involve them in the decision and get their buy-in

questions.explanation: Onboard your fund ops team first. Don't surprise your CFO or fund administrator with a new system. Involve them in the decision. Have them test the platforms. Get their buy-in. They need to use this regularly. If they find it confusing or harder than their current process, they'll resist and you'll end up maintaining two systems.

questions.question: What is the worst situation when transitioning to fund operations software?

options.text: Maintaining two systems of record - dual entry creates errors, inconsistency, and extra work

questions.explanation: The worst situation is maintaining two systems of record for your fund's finances. Dual entry creates errors, inconsistency, and extra work. Set a hard cutoff date. Move all data into the new system. Deprecate the old system. Don't let 'we'll transition gradually' drag on for months.

questions.question: What should you start with when implementing fund operations software?

options.text: Configure every feature on day one
Start with the basics - get capital management, portfolio tracking, and LP reporting working first

questions.explanation: Start with the basics. Don't try to configure every feature on day one. Get capital management, portfolio tracking, and LP reporting working first. You can add fund forecasting models, portfolio metrics tracking, and sophisticated analytics later. The core operations need to work before you optimize.

questions.question: How does fund operations software help with fundraising your next fund?

options.text: It generates track record materials, portfolio summaries, and performance metrics automatically
It only helps with current fund operations
It replaces the need for fundraising

questions.explanation: Fund operations software helps with fundraising by generating track record materials (portfolio company performance, investment pace, realized returns), portfolio summaries (companies, investment dates, check sizes, current valuations), and performance metrics (IRR, TVPI, DPI, MOIC) automatically. You're not building presentation materials from scratch.

questions.question: How do valuations and fair value work in fund operations software?

options.text: All investments are marked at cost
Early-stage investments often carry at cost until there's a markup event; later-stage funds might need more sophisticated valuation models
You only mark valuations once per year

questions.explanation: Mark your portfolio to fair value each quarter. Early-stage investments often carry at cost until there's a markup event (new funding round at higher valuation). Later-stage funds might need more sophisticated valuation models. The system helps you track valuations consistently and document your methodology for auditors.

questions.question: Why does 'founder experience' matter when choosing a fund operations platform?

options.text: If your platform collects data directly from portfolio companies, multiple investors using different tools means founders get bombarded with redundant requests
Founders don't interact with these platforms
It only matters for large funds

questions.explanation: Founder experience matters. If your platform collects data directly from portfolio companies (financials, KPIs, updates), consider the founder experience. Multiple investors using different collection tools means founders get bombarded with redundant requests. Some platforms are more founder-friendly than others. This affects response rates and data quality.

questions.question: What is the exception to the 'buy don't build' rule for fund operations?

options.text: Very large funds with significant engineering and operations resources have built custom platforms including LP portals and automated reporting

questions.explanation: The exception: very large funds with significant engineering and operations resources have built custom fund operations platforms including LP portals, automated reporting, and investor relations tools. If you're managing multiple billion-dollar funds with dedicated platform teams, custom infrastructure might make sense. For everyone else, even large established funds, buying off the shelf is the right choice.

questions.question: What does fund forecasting help with?

options.text: Modeling scenarios for deployment pace, capital calls, distributions, and projected metrics to help manage the fund proactively and communicate with LPs

questions.explanation: Fund forecasting helps you model out future fund performance. What happens if you deploy capital faster or slower? When will you need to make capital calls? When are distributions likely? What's the projected IRR and TVPI at different exit scenarios? This helps you manage the fund proactively and communicate with LPs about future expectations.
